manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a pillow and a bed. The wardrobe is closed. The pillow is on the bed. There is a passage to a hallway here.

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a pillow and a bed. The wardrobe is closed. The pillow is on the bed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
> take pillow
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a pillow and a bed. The wardrobe is closed. The pillow is on the bed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
> take pillow
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.
> go to hallway
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a living room, a broom closet, a bedroom and a kitchen here.

You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a table, a chair, a shelf, a book and a couch. The book is on the side table. There is a passage to a hallway here.
